jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
San Francisco | Stealth Startup | AI-powered shopping | 5 Days Onsite

We’re building a gamified, AI-powered shopping experience that helps people discover fashion they truly love — without wasting hours searching. By making shopping feel strategic, fun, and personal, we empower users to make smarter spending choices.

At our core, we’re an agentic AI commerce startup reimagining how people discover fashion and how brands move inventory — smarter and faster.

Founded by Sebastian Thrun (founder of Google X, Waymo, Udacity, Kitty Hawk), our team brings deep expertise from Microsoft, Google, Snap, and fashion leaders like Farfetch and Net-a-Porter.

What You’ll Do 💪

  • Design and ship delightful product experiences for mobile and web

  • Design compelling graphics for marketing efforts across our product, landing page, and socials

  • Partner with product engineers to define what we build - from scoping to iterating on flows to high-fidelity mocks

  • Partner with marketing and brand partnership to communicate and deliver our product to the world - from new feature launches to ~vibes~

  • Use data, user research, product context, and design instinct to inform your decisions

  • Bring clarity to complex problems and delight to polished experiences

What You’ll Bring 🫡

  • 2–3 years of experience designing & shipping digital products, ideally at a startup or in consumer social

  • A portfolio that shows clear thinking, strong visuals, and product intuition and reasoning

  • Experience designing UX and UI for both web and mobile

  • Experience working on multiple projects at the same time

  • Graphic design experience a plus

  • Strong grasp of visual hierarchy, layout, and typography - an eye for quality and polish

  • A collaborative mindset

Bonus Points 🫨

Not required, but let us know if you have experience with:

  • Fashion and commerce design projects

  • Focused on Gen Z–oriented experiences

  • Motion design or microanimations (Lottie, Rive ,CSS, Windsurf, Lovable)

  • Prototyping

  • Storyboarding for animations and demo videos

  • UX writing or microcopy

  • Front-end development

  • Creating iconsets

  • Design systems

  • Video Editing

  • User Research

Why Join Us:

  • You’ll be one of our first hires and have a real seat at the table

  • You’ll shape the growth engine from day one — and see the impact of your work immediately

  • You’ll work alongside experienced, thoughtful founders and a team that genuinely loves what we’re building

  • Competitive comp + meaningful equity

  • Big upside, fast feedback loops, and the satisfaction of building something from zero

jobs.title: Member of Technical Staff - Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Member of Technical Staff - Data Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA

Role Type: Full-time, Individual Contributor

About Us

Sage Labs is redefining product discovery with AI-driven search and personalization. We operate at the intersection of machine learning, distributed systems, and high-performance computing, tackling some of commerce’s toughest engineering challenges.

We have a flat structure that prioritizes execution over hierarchy. As a Data Engineer you’ll design and build the core data infrastructure powering our platform, ensuring seamless data flow at scale.

Your Impact

  • Architect and maintain ETL pipelines to ingest and process third-party data

  • Build real-time and batch pipelines that power AI-driven search, recommendations, and personalization

  • Optimize storage, retrieval, and performance for AI models

  • Enhance data lineage, observability, and governance

  • Partner with AI engineers and backend teams to optimize data flows

Who You Are

  • 8+ years in data engineering, infrastructure, or backend systems

  • Scaled data systems from 0 to 1, including data catalogs and metadata management

  • Hands-on with Kafka, Flink, Beam, or Spark

  • Proficient in BigQuery, Snowflake, or Redshift or other real-time toolkits

  • Strong SQL, Python, and distributed systems background

  • Familiarity with vector databases and AI-powered data pipelines

Why Join Us?

  • This is a high-impact, high-ownership role where you'll own a lot

  • Work alongside AI experts and startup veterans

  • Rare opportunity to shape data systems in a 0-to-1 environment

  • Competitive compensation & equity—We’re in this for the long haul

If you're passionate about designing scalable data systems for AI-driven applications, we want to hear from you

Apply now or reach out to build@sagelabs.ai

No recruiters or agencies please
jobs.descriptionPlain:
MEMBER OF TECHNICAL STAFF - DATA ENGINEER


LOCATION: SAN FRANCISCO, CA


ROLE TYPE: FULL-TIME, INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTOR


ABOUT US

Sage Labs is redefining product discovery with AI-driven search and personalization. We operate at the intersection of machine learning, distributed systems, and high-performance computing, tackling some of commerce’s toughest engineering challenges.

We have a flat structure that prioritizes execution over hierarchy. As a Data Engineer you’ll design and build the core data infrastructure powering our platform, ensuring seamless data flow at scale.


YOUR IMPACT

 - Build real-time and batch pipelines that power AI-driven search, recommendations, and personalization

 - Optimize storage, retrieval, and performance for AI models

 - Enhance data lineage, observability, and governance

 - Partner with AI engineers and backend teams to optimize data flows


WHO YOU ARE

 - 8+ years in data engineering, infrastructure, or backend systems

 - Scaled data systems from 0 to 1, including data catalogs and metadata management

 - Hands-on with Kafka, Flink, Beam, or Spark

 - Proficient in BigQuery, Snowflake, or Redshift or other real-time toolkits

 - Strong SQL, Python, and distributed systems background

 - Familiarity with vector databases and AI-powered data pipelines

Why Join Us?

 - This is a high-impact, high-ownership role where you'll own a lot

 - Work alongside AI experts and startup veterans

 - Rare opportunity to shape data systems in a 0-to-1 environment

 - Competitive compensation & equity—We’re in this for the long haul

If you're passionate about designing scalable data systems for AI-driven applications, we want to hear from you

Apply now or reach out to build@sagelabs.ai

No recruiters or agencies please

jobs.title: Member of Technical Staff - Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Member of Technical Staff - Backend Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA

Job Type: Full-time

Sage Labs is an AI-powered commerce startup revolutionizing product discovery. We work at the intersection of machine learning, distributed systems, and high-performance computing, building cutting-edge search and discovery experiences. Backed by industry leaders, we are solving some of commerce’s toughest engineering challenges.

We operate with a flat structure, emphasizing direction and execution over hierarchy. As a Backend Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain the core services powering our AI-driven platform. This is a hands-on role for an engineer who thrives in complex, high-scale environments.

Your Impact

  • Design scalable backend systems—Develop high-throughput, low-latency services for AI-driven search

  • Ensure reliability—Optimize performance, fault tolerance, and observability at scale

  • Develop APIs—Build well-documented, efficient APIs for seamless data exchange

  • Enhance CI/CD—Automate deployment and release workflows

  • Integrate AI/ML—Collaborate on AI-driven recommendations and personalization

  • Secure systems—Implement best practices for data security and compliance

  • Boost developer productivity—Improve internal tooling and workflows

Who You Are

  • Backend expert—7+ years in distributed systems, HPC, or cloud infrastructure

  • Programming skills—Fluent in Python, Go, or Rust, with scalable system experience

  • Cloud knowledge—Expertise in AWS, GCP, or Azure, including serverless and containerized workloads

  • DevOps experience—Hands-on with Terraform, Kubernetes, and CI/CD

  • Data-driven—Familiar with real-time data processing and high-availability architectures

  • Bias for action—Move fast while balancing sustainability

  • Startup-ready—Thrive in ambiguity, adapt to change

Why Join Us?

  • Build from the ground up—Shape the future of AI-first commerce

  • Collaborate with top engineers—Solve cutting-edge problems in AI and commerce

  • Own meaningful projects—Make an impact on architecture and product

  • Competitive package—Salary, equity, and benefits

If you're an engineer eager to build AI-driven systems and transform commerce, we want to hear from you

Apply now or reach out to build@sagelabs.ai

No recruiters or agencies please

jobs.title: Growth Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
We’re an agentic AI-powered commerce startup redefining how people discover fashion and how brands move inventory smarter and faster. Our mission is simple: help great products find the right people through personalized discovery that feels intuitive.

Why This Role Matters
We’re at zero-to-one — and this role is about building the engine that gets us to ten. You’ll work directly with the founder to shape the growth strategy, test and scale channels, and own the KPIs that drive the business forward.

This is not a plug-and-play growth job. It’s for someone who’s excited to experiment, move fast, and help build the blueprint from scratch. You’ll need to be scrappy. Strategic. Experimental. You'll touch everything from paid and organic to onboarding and referral — then help build the playbook as we grow the team.

What You’ll Do

  • Roll up your sleeves to launch and iterate across paid social, influencer, ambassador, referral, email/SMS, and more

  • Design and run rapid experiments to test channel viability and optimize performance

  • Own growth KPIs and build the dashboard/reporting infrastructure to track them (CAC, LTV, conversion, retention, etc.)

  • Partner with content, product, and design to optimize the full funnel — from acquisition to daily engagement

  • Bring creative ideas to the table constantly: hooks, angles, incentives, content, partnerships

  • Think like a founder: prioritize ruthlessly, move fast, and never wait around for permission

  • Build the foundation now, with an eye toward offloading and scaling over time

You Might Be a Fit If You...

  • Have 3–7 years of experience in growth, performance marketing, or DTC/ecomm at a high-growth consumer startup

  • Are creative and experimental by nature — you love a test-and-learn environment

  • Have experience launching new channels or products from scratch

  • Are deeply hands-on — you're just as comfortable writing ad copy or setting up campaigns as you are building a strategy

  • Have strong analytical chops and know how to turn data into action

  • Crave ownership and the thrill of building something people love

Bonus If You…

  • Have scaled paid social campaigns on a budget

  • Have worked on a consumer brand targeting Gen Z

  • Have experience with influencer, ambassador, or community-driven growth programs

Why Join Us

  • You’ll be one of our first hires and have a real seat at the table

  • You’ll shape the growth engine from day one — and see the impact of your work immediately

  • You’ll work alongside experienced, thoughtful founders and a team that genuinely loves what we’re building

  • Competitive comp + meaningful equity

  • Big upside, fast feedback loops, and the satisfaction of building something from zero

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: San Francisco

Type: Full-time

About Us

We’re an agentic AI commerce startup redefining how people discover fashion and how brands move inventory smarter and faster. Our mission is simple: help great products find the right people through personalized, intuitive, and effortless discovery.

Backed by top investors and led by an experienced founder with deep roots in machine learning, we’re moving fast and scaling quickly.

We’re looking for a Marketing Manager who thrives in a hands-on environment and can own the execution and optimization of our marketing operations. This is an "all hands on deck" role — you’ll be in the weeds setting up campaigns, while also thinking strategically about how we scale and automate.

What You’ll Do

  • Own marketing operations across channels: email, SMS, push notifications, and other lifecycle campaigns.

  • Build, execute, and optimize campaigns — from copy + creative coordination to targeting, testing, and reporting.

  • Manage our marketing tech stack (ESP, CRM, analytics, attribution, SMS/push platforms, etc.) and ensure systems are connected and data flows correctly.

  • Run multi-channel campaigns end-to-end: copy, creative coordination, targeting, QA, deployment, reporting.

  • Segment and personalize campaigns to improve engagement, retention, and LTV.

  • Set up automations and lifecycle flows (welcome series, reactivation, upsell/cross-sell, referral, etc.).

  • Track, analyze, and report on campaign performance, experimenting constantly to improve open rates, CTRs, conversions, and ROI.

  • Partner with product, growth, and CX teams to align messaging and drive user adoption.

  • Stay scrappy — from writing subject lines to QA’ing flows, you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and make things happen.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2–4+ years in marketing operations, lifecycle marketing, or CRM at a consumer tech, AI, or subscription-based company.

  • Hands-on experience with email/SMS/push tools

  • Deep understanding of customer segmentation, targeting, and personalization.

  • Comfortable setting up multi-channel automations and A/B tests.

  • Data-driven mindset: you track performance metrics and iterate quickly.

  • A builder mentality — excited to experiment, optimize, and create from scratch in a fast-paced environment.

  • Excellent project management skills; can juggle multiple campaigns and priorities.

  • Strong communication skills; you’re as comfortable writing copy as you are analyzing results.

Bonus Points

  • Experience in consumer AI, apps, or subscription products.

  • Comfort with SQL or lightweight data analysis.

  • Familiarity with attribution tools (Amplitude, GA, etc.).

  • Startup or “0 to 1” experience building marketing ops from the ground up.

Why Join Us?

  • Be at the forefront of consumer AI, shaping how people interact with technology.

  • Build and scale marketing operations in a high-growth environment.

  • Work with a small, scrappy team that values experimentation, creativity, and execution.

  • Opportunity to own marketing operations end-to-end and grow into a leadership role as the company scales.

Location: San Francisco

Type: Full-time


ABOUT US

We’re an agentic AI commerce startup redefining how people discover fashion and how brands move inventory smarter and faster. Our mission is simple: help great products find the right people through personalized, intuitive, and effortless discovery.

We’re looking for a Marketing Manager who thrives in a hands-on environment and can own the execution and optimization of our marketing operations. This is an "all hands on deck" role — you’ll be in the weeds setting up campaigns, while also thinking strategically about how we scale and automate.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Build, execute, and optimize campaigns — from copy + creative coordination to targeting, testing, and reporting.

 - Manage our marketing tech stack (ESP, CRM, analytics, attribution, SMS/push platforms, etc.) and ensure systems are connected and data flows correctly.

 - Set up automations and lifecycle flows (welcome series, reactivation, upsell/cross-sell, referral, etc.).

 - Partner with product, growth, and CX teams to align messaging and drive user adoption.

 - Stay scrappy — from writing subject lines to QA’ing flows, you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and make things happen.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 2–4+ years in marketing operations, lifecycle marketing, or CRM at a consumer tech, AI, or subscription-based company.

 - Hands-on experience with email/SMS/push tools

 - Deep understanding of customer segmentation, targeting, and personalization.

 - Comfortable setting up multi-channel automations and A/B tests.

 - Data-driven mindset: you track performance metrics and iterate quickly.

 - A builder mentality — excited to experiment, optimize, and create from scratch in a fast-paced environment.

 - Excellent project management skills; can juggle multiple campaigns and priorities.

 - Strong communication skills; you’re as comfortable writing copy as you are analyzing results.


BONUS POINTS

 - Experience in consumer AI, apps, or subscription products.

 - Comfort with SQL or lightweight data analysis.

 - Familiarity with attribution tools (Amplitude, GA, etc.).

 - Startup or “0 to 1” experience building marketing ops from the ground up.


WHY JOIN US?

 - Be at the forefront of consumer AI, shaping how people interact with technology.

 - Build and scale marketing operations in a high-growth environment.

 - Work with a small, scrappy team that values experimentation, creativity, and execution.

 - Opportunity to own marketing operations end-to-end and grow into a leadership role as the company scales.

jobs.title: Order Operations Intern (Paid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Remote (US-based, authorized to work in the U.S.)

Compensation: $20/hour

Commitment: Contract role, daily 6:00–7:30 PM PST (with occasional extension to 8:30 PM), including weekends

About Us

We’re an agentic AI-powered commerce startup backed by top investors and led by proven founders with deep roots in consumer, retail, and marketplaces. Our mission is to redefine how people discover fashion and how brands move inventory smarter and faster. We’re building from 0 → 1, and this is a rare opportunity to help shape the future of shopping while working alongside some of the top minds in machine learning and commerce.

The Role

We’re looking for a detail-oriented Order Operations Intern to support our daily order placement and tracking workflow. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that every customer order is placed accurately and on time through our CRM, while monitoring deliveries and keeping order statuses up to date. This is a fast-paced, hands-on role where precision, consistency, and reliability are key.

What You’ll Do

  • Place customer orders daily through our CRM — think of it like the full checkout process when shopping for yourself: once the product is in the cart, you move through checkout, enter the address and payment details, and complete the order until it’s fully confirmed. The difference is you’ll be doing this at scale, from 5 to 100+ orders each day.

  • Manage multiple orders at once and ensure every purchase is processed correctly and on time

  • Monitor deliveries, track shipments, and update order statuses in real time

  • Troubleshoot basic order issues (e.g., declined payments, incorrect addresses, delayed shipments) and escalate when needed

  • Maintain consistency and attention to detail across a large number of transactions

  • Collaborate with the CX and ops teams to refine processes and streamline workflows as the company scales

What We’re Looking For

  • Fast learner with a high typing speed and excellent accuracy

  • Strong attention to detail and ability to catch small errors before they turn into bigger issues

  • Comfortable navigating new tools and processes in a fast-moving startup environment

  • Reliable and consistent — able to commit to daily evening hours, including weekends

  • Previous experience in operations, e-commerce, retail, or customer support is a plus (especially if you’ve worked with CRMs or order systems), but not required

Why Join Us

  • $20/hour contract role with consistent daily schedule (1.5–2.5 hours per evening)

  • Remote-friendly, U.S.-based opportunity

  • Unique chance to contribute meaningfully at the 0 → 1 stage of company building

  • Learn operational best practices and gain experience in the fast-paced world of e-commerce and retail tech

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer (React Native)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: San Francisco, CA (In-Office, 5 Days/Week)
Type: Full-time
Experience Level: Senior (5+ years), Lead/Staff (7+ years)
Start Date: ASAP

About Us

We’re building GOLD, the next-generation super shopping app — a powerful, intuitive AI shopping agent designed to streamline how people discover and buy products online. Our mission is to help people get the best deals on the products they love, through a seamless and delightful shopping experience. Early launches have shown that users love the experience, and the company is entering growth mode to bring this experience into more hands.

We’re an early-stage startup based in San Francisco, led by the founder of GoogleX, Waymo and Udacity. Our team is lean, driven, and highly collaborative. If you're excited about building impactful technology from the ground up — and working shoulder-to-shoulder with an experienced founder — we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead the design, development, and deployment of our flagship iOS app built with React Native

  • Build and maintain high-performance and scalable mobile experiences
    Collaborate closely with design, product, backend engineering and AI research teams to ship shopping features

  • Define the architecture and technical roadmap for the iOS app as we scale

  • Own critical product features end-to-end, from prototype to production

  • Help set and promote mobile engineering best practices, code quality, and performance standards

  • Provide mentorship and technical guidance to other engineers as we grow the team

What We’re Looking For

  • 5-7+ years of professional mobile development experience, with proven expertise shipping consumer-facing apps

  • Deep expertise in React Native and strong experience with TypeScript/Node.js

  • Solid understanding of iOS-specific tooling (Xcode, provisioning, TestFlight) and deployment processes

  • Experience integrating with REST APIs

  • Strong grasp of mobile performance optimization, offline-first design, and UI/UX best practices

  • Comfortable working across the stack with backend engineers when needed

  • Bonus: experience with e-commerce or high-traffic consumer apps

  • Bonus: past experience leading teams or mentoring other developers

  • Bonus: previous experience with Expo Framework

Our Tech Stack

  • Mobile App: React Native, TypeScript

  • Backend: TypeScript (Node.js) and Python

  • Infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform

  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions, TestFlight, EAS

Why Join Us

  • Make an impact – Your work will be foundational to the product and user experience

  • In-person collaboration – Join a focused, fast-moving team working together daily in San Francisco

  • Proven leadership – Work directly with a founder who has built transformative technology companies
    Startup ownership – Influence product and engineering decisions from day one
    Compensation & equity – Well-funded startup with competitive salary, meaningful equity
jobs.descriptionPlain:
Location: San Francisco, CA (In-Office, 5 Days/Week)
Type: Full-time
Experience Level: Senior (5+ years), Lead/Staff (7+ years)
Start Date: ASAP


ABOUT US

We’re building GOLD https://shopongold.com/, the next-generation super shopping app — a powerful, intuitive AI shopping agent designed to streamline how people discover and buy products online. Our mission is to help people get the best deals on the products they love, through a seamless and delightful shopping experience. Early launches have shown that users love the experience, and the company is entering growth mode to bring this experience into more hands.

We’re an early-stage startup based in San Francisco, led by the founder of GoogleX, Waymo and Udacity. Our team is lean, driven, and highly collaborative. If you're excited about building impactful technology from the ground up — and working shoulder-to-shoulder with an experienced founder — we’d love to meet you.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Lead the design, development, and deployment of our flagship iOS app built with React Native

 - Build and maintain high-performance and scalable mobile experiences
   Collaborate closely with design, product, backend engineering and AI research teams to ship shopping features

 - Define the architecture and technical roadmap for the iOS app as we scale

 - Own critical product features end-to-end, from prototype to production

 - Help set and promote mobile engineering best practices, code quality, and performance standards

 - Provide mentorship and technical guidance to other engineers as we grow the team
   


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 5-7+ years of professional mobile development experience, with proven expertise shipping consumer-facing apps

 - Deep expertise in React Native and strong experience with TypeScript/Node.js
   

 - Solid understanding of iOS-specific tooling (Xcode, provisioning, TestFlight) and deployment processes

 - Experience integrating with REST APIs

 - Strong grasp of mobile performance optimization, offline-first design, and UI/UX best practices

 - Comfortable working across the stack with backend engineers when needed

 - Bonus: experience with e-commerce or high-traffic consumer apps

 - Bonus: past experience leading teams or mentoring other developers

 - Bonus: previous experience with Expo Framework
   


OUR TECH STACK

 - Mobile App: React Native, TypeScript

 - Backend: TypeScript (Node.js) and Python

 - Infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform

 - CI/CD: GitHub Actions, TestFlight, EAS
   


WHY JOIN US

 - Make an impact – Your work will be foundational to the product and user experience

 - In-person collaboration – Join a focused, fast-moving team working together daily in San Francisco

 - Proven leadership – Work directly with a founder who has built transformative technology companies
   Startup ownership – Influence product and engineering decisions from day one
   Compensation & equity – Well-funded startup with competitive salary, meaningful equity

jobs.title: AI Engineer – Product & Personalization
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We’re building the AI-powered super shopping app — a powerful, intuitive platform designed to streamline how people discover and buy products online. Our mission is to help people get the best deals on the products they love, through a fast, intelligent, and delightful experience.

We’re an early-stage startup based in San Francisco, led by the founder of Waymo and Udacity. With data at the core of our product, we’re leveraging AI to power everything from personalization to pricing — and we're looking for exceptional engineers to shape that future.

About the Role

We’re looking for a sharp, product-focused AI Engineer to join our team and own key machine learning systems that directly impact user experience and revenue. You’ll be responsible for building and deploying intelligent systems across several high-leverage areas: product personalization and recommendations, and a scalable A/B testing platform.

This is a hands-on, highly collaborative role with direct influence over product direction and growth. You'll work closely with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to turn raw data into real-world impact — including supporting brand partnership pitches through insights and modeling.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop and deploy ML models for product personalization and recommendations

  • Build dynamic pricing and bidding algorithms to optimize conversion and margin

  • Architect and maintain a scalable A/B testing and experimentation platform

  • Collaborate on data and insights to support brand partnerships and growth efforts

  • Own the full model lifecycle — from prototype to production monitoring and iteration

  • Work closely with infrastructure and backend teams to integrate AI into the product

What We’re Looking For

  • 4–6+ years of experience in applied machine learning or data science roles

  • Strong foundation in ML algorithms, modeling, evaluation techniques, and deployment practices

  • Proficiency in Python and ML libraries like scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, or TensorFlow

  • Experience with embeddings, recommender systems, ranking models

  • Familiarity with experimentation design and statistical testing (e.g., A/B testing)

  • Comfort working cross-functionally in a fast-paced, early-stage environment

  • Bonus: ability to translate model performance into clear business and product impact

Our Tech Stack

  • Languages: Python, SQL, TypeScript

  • Libraries: scikit-learn, PyTorch, custom models

  • Infra: GCP (BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub), PostgreSQL

  • Tooling: In-house + open-source tools for monitoring, model ops, and testing

Why Join Us

  • Direct impact – Your models will drive user experience, pricing, and growth strategies

  • Work across the stack – Collaborate with backend, infra, and data teams to ship AI into production

  • In-person momentum – Join a tight-knit, focused team working together daily in San Francisco

  • Proven leadership – Build alongside the founder of Google X, Waymo and Udacity

  • Compensation & equity – Well-funded startup with competitive salary and meaningful

    equity

jobs.title: Customer Experience & Operations Support (Contract, Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Remote (U.S.-based preferred)
Type: Part-time Contract
Schedule: Off-hours and weekends required


About Us
We’re a high-growth agentic consumer startup based in San Francisco, building the next generation of shopping — smarter, faster, and more personalized. Backed by top investors, we’re scaling quickly, and every team member has the opportunity to make a meaningful impact as we redefine how people discover and shop online.

Role Overview
We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Customer Experience & Operations Support contractor to join our growing team. This person will play a key role in delivering best-in-class customer support, facilitating smooth order fulfillment, and maintaining seamless operations — especially during off-hours and weekends.

Responsibilities

  • Respond to customer inquiries with speed, empathy, and accuracy

  • Support order processing, tracking, and issue resolution

  • Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth and timely fulfillment

  • Identify and escalate recurring issues or operational bottlenecks

  • Maintain high service standards and ensure a positive customer experience

Qualifications

  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills

  • Experience in customer support, e-commerce, or operations

  • Highly organized, reliable, and comfortable working independently

  • Flexible availability, including evenings, early mornings, and weekends

  • Excited to join an early-stage, fast-paced startup and grow with us

Compensation & Details

  • Role Type: Remote, part-time contract

  • Schedule: Off-hours and weekend coverage required

  • Growth: Opportunity for expanded hours and long-term engagement

  • Compensation: $25 per hour
